alert.note: Alert for Tom Green (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 19 at 8:46PM CDT until May 19 at 11:15PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Angelo has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... western and central Tom Green County in west central Texas... * Until 1115 PM CDT. * At 840 PM CDT, Radar showed an area of thunderstorms with very heavy rain, overspreading San Angelo and western Tom Green County from Irion County. Rainfall amounts of 1.5 to 2.5 inches is expected, as the area of thunderstorms gradually moves east across the area. This very heavy rain in a short period of time is expected to result in flash flooding of streets in San Angelo, and flash flooding of low-lying areas and possibly some creeks in Tom Green County. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... San Angelo, Goodfellow Air Force Base, Lake Nasworthy, O.c. Fisher Reservoir, Wall, Twin Buttes Reservoir, San Angelo State Park, Veribest, Grape Creek, Tankersley, Knickerbocker, Vancourt and Harriet. This includes the following Low Water Crossings... Howard and Webster, Southwest Blvd and Loop 306, Jackson From Knickerbocker to South Bryant, College Hills and Millbrook, FM 2334 crossing Dry Lipan Creek, Huntington and Sunset, Sul Ross At Red Arroyo Crossing, FM 2334 crossing Ninemile Creek, FM 1692 crossing Sales Branch and FM 1692 crossing Concho River. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
